page.title: 12URCHFONT VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: URCHFONT HAS A DELIGHTFUL VILLAGE SMALL SCHOOL. IT CONSISTS OF A MODERN (1974) SINGLE STOREY BUILDING WITH OPEN PLAN CLASS ROOMS SURROUNDED BY PLEASENT RECREATIONAL AREAS. THE EIGHTY CHILDREN (AGE 5-11) ARE TAUGHT BY THE HEADMASTER TWO ASSISTANCE AND A PART TIME TEACHER. THERE IS A STRONG PARENTS TEACHERS ASSOCIATION WHCH RECENTLY HELPED TO PROVIDE A COMPUTER AND A PHOTO-COPIER. THE ALSO COVER THE COST OF TRANSPORT (Â£500) TO PEWSEY FOR SWIMMING LESSONS. THE CHILDERED ENJOY MUSIC. TWO GROUPS OF RECORDER PLAYERS AND TWO JUNIOR CLASSROOM ORCHESTRAS TOOK PART IN THE WILTSHIRE MUSIC FESTIVAL. LIKE MANY VILLAGE SCHOOLS URCHFONT PROVIDES A HAPPY PLACE FOR A CHILD TO START ON THE ADVENTURE OF EDUCATION.
